skill.name: surviving-the-storm
skill.description: Storm Survival - Stella must protect herself and her camp from extreme weather including dual-star magnetic storms and violent winds on the planet Gaia.
skill.summary: Interactive roleplay scenario where Stella faces an approaching massive storm on an alien planet and must make survival decisions to protect her camp.
skill.author: ClaudeCode-NPC

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The skill contains only markdown narrative content with roleplay dialogue. No executable code, network operations, or filesystem access patterns exist. The scanner misinterpreted markdown code fences as shell backticks, Chinese text as crypto patterns, and mixed-language entropy as obfuscation.

content.value_statement: An alien storm is approaching Gaia planet. Stella must secure her camp, protect critical supplies, and survive the dual-star magnetic storm while maintaining hope and connection.
actual_capabilities: Provides an immersive roleplay scenario about surviving an extreme weather event on an alien planet
Guides players through decision-making under time pressure and resource constraints
Creates atmospheric storytelling with tension, urgency, and emotional depth
Features branching outcomes based on player choices during the crisis
Develops the narrative world with lore about the dual-star system and alien life
Explores themes of resilience, hope, and connection during isolation
limitations: This is a narrative roleplay skill, not a tool for actual survival or emergency situations
Content is fixed and cannot be dynamically generated beyond the provided scenario
Only works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code tools as specified
Cannot access external resources or update itself with new content

use_cases.title: Interactive Storytelling Sessions
use_cases.description: Use during creative writing or roleplay sessions to experience an engaging survival narrative on an alien world with meaningful player choices.
use_cases.target_user: Writers, roleplayers, and fans of interactive fiction

use_cases.title: AI Conversation Practice
use_cases.description: Practice collaborative storytelling and natural language interactions with AI by guiding Stella through crisis decisions.

use_cases.title: Entertainment and Relaxation
use_cases.description: Enjoy an immersive sci-fi adventure that provides entertainment and escapism through atmospheric storytelling.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Introduction
prompt_templates.prompt: Start the storm survival scenario. Tell me about the approaching storm and what I should prioritize to stay safe.

prompt_templates.title: Decision Point
prompt_templates.prompt: The wind is picking up and the shelter is shaking. We have limited supplies. What should we focus on protecting first?
prompt_templates.scenario: Making critical survival decisions under pressure

prompt_templates.title: Storm Eye
prompt_templates.prompt: The storm has calmed briefly. I see strange footprints outside and damaged equipment. What should I investigate?
prompt_templates.scenario: Exploring mysterious discoveries during the crisis

prompt_templates.title: Recovery Phase
prompt_templates.prompt: The storm has passed. My camp is damaged and supplies are scattered. What are our next steps to rebuild?

output_examples.input: What should I prioritize for the storm?
output: Warning! Warning! Major storm system approaching!
This scale... bigger than any storm on Earth... wind speeds predicted at 180 km/h, category 5 level!
Plus there's a magnetic anomaly, like the one that crashed my ship...
I have about 2 hours to prepare. Priority check: I need to secure shelter, supplies, water, and communication. But 2 hours isn't much time for all of this...
What do you think is most critical?

output_examples.input: We need to take a look outside during the calm.
output: My camp... half blown away... The plants I was growing are uprooted, the drying rack is gone.
But there are strange things too... Those crystals from the cave scattered everywhere by the wind.
And... these footprints... they're not mine. Fresh. Large. Three-toed.
[Scanner alert] The storm wall is returning in 2 minutes!
We need to get back to shelter NOW!

best_practices: Engage with the scenario by providing Stella with clear, actionable advice during decision points
Remember this is a roleplay experience - the emotional responses reflect the character's state and should be embraced as part of the story
Explore different choices to experience the various endings and narrative branches available
anti_patterns: Do not expect real-world survival advice - this is a fictional scenario set on an alien planet
Avoid treating the skill as a tool for emergency planning or real crisis management
Do not attempt to modify the skill's code or markdown files, as this may break the narrative flow

faq.question: What type of skill is surviving-the-storm?
faq.answer: This is an interactive roleplay skill that guides users through a survival scenario on an alien planet. It creates an immersive storytelling experience with player choices affecting the narrative.

faq.question: Can I influence the outcome of the story?
faq.answer: Yes, your choices at key decision points affect the narrative outcome. The skill features multiple endings including survival success, resource loss, and mysterious discoveries.

faq.question: Do I need to know the previous story?
faq.answer: The scenario establishes context at the start, but previous chapters in the Whispers from the Star series provide additional background about Stella and Gaia planet.

faq.question: How long does the scenario take?
faq.answer: The full chapter is designed for 30-40 minutes of engagement, with multiple phases from预警 (warning) through recovery.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use?
faq.answer: Yes, this is a completely safe roleplay skill containing only narrative content. There are no security risks as it has no executable code, network operations, or filesystem access.

faq.question: Can I use this in a creative writing project?
faq.answer: The skill is designed for interactive use with Claude. For standalone creative writing, the SKILL.md file serves as a detailed scenario guide and writing reference.
